intro: Hedeoma teyucuarensis, commonly known as the Teyucuarensis hedeoma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinct, pungent scent, which contributes to its ecological role in attracting pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
